doc.field: Series VI: Alternative Histories was an exhibition that presented a microhistory of New York City's artist-run, nonprofit, and experimental spaces since the 1960s. This exhibition was curated by Herb Tam, Lauren Rosati, Papo Colo, and Jeanette Ingberman. This series preserves a variety of historical documents that were exclusively part of the show and originally displayed in 18"x12" flat cardboard boxes. Contents include ephemera, photographs, promotional materials, and published works contributed by and about 130 different art organizations. For Alternative Histories administrative files, promotional records, and submissions that did not make it into the show, see Series I: Exhibition Files.
